## Vocabulary Introduction

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
- பொருள் (porul) - thing/object
- கைப்பொருள் (kaiporul) - handheld object
- பயன் (payan) - use/benefit
- மரம் (maram) - tree
- துப்பு (thuppu) - clue/lead
- எழுத்து (ezhuthu) - letter/writing
:::
::: {.column width="50%"}
- சொல் (sol) - word
- புன்சொல் (punsol) - trivial word
- அகரம் (agaram) - alphabet
- மழை (mazhai) - rain
- வற்றல் (vatral) - dried item
- கனி (kani) - fruit
:::
:::

## Activity 1: Object Identification Game

1. Prepare cards with pictures or actual objects representing the words
2. Students take turns picking a card/object and saying the Tamil word
3. For abstract concepts, use creative representations

::: {.notes}
Instructor: Prepare cards or objects beforehand. Encourage students to form simple sentences using the words they identify.
:::

## Activity 2: Word Categorization Exercise

Group the words into categories:

1. Nature: மரம், மழை, கனி
2. Language: எழுத்து, சொல், புன்சொல், அகரம்
3. Abstract concepts: பொருள், பயன், துப்பு
4. Descriptive: வற்றல், தளிர்த்தற்று, மாசு

::: {.notes}
Instructor: Discuss why each word belongs to its category. Encourage students to think of additional words for each category.
:::

## Activity 3: Descriptive Sentence Formation

Create sentences using multiple words from the lesson:

1. மரம் கனி தளிர்த்தற்று (The tree sprouted fruit)
2. மழை பொருள் மாசு (Rain thing dirt)
3. எழுத்து சொல் அகரம் (Letter word alphabet)

::: {.notes}
Instructor: Help students understand the basic sentence structure. Encourage them to create their own sentences and share with the class.
:::

## Practice Time!

In pairs, create a short story using at least 5 words from today's lesson.

Example:
மரம் கனி தளிர்த்தற்று. மழை வந்தது. கனி வற்றல் ஆனது.
(The tree sprouted fruit. Rain came. The fruit became dried.)

## Recap

We learned:  
1. Nouns related to objects and nature  
2. Abstract concepts  
3. Words related to language  
4. Basic sentence formation with nouns  

## Homework

1. Write 10 sentences using today's vocabulary
2. Draw and label 5 objects from the lesson
3. Find 3 new words that could fit into our categories
